reference.title: Macro Tips
reference.shortdesc: Some tips in working with macros.

section.title: Relative References
section.p: Recorded macros will use absolute cell references by default. This means that the exact locations of cells, rows, and columns in the program code of the macro will be used. The macro works then always at the same addresses.
When you want to use relative references in the macro you need to click on the button Use Relative References.

note.p: This setting remains active until you undo the setting by clicking on this button again.

section.title: Running macros
section.p: Macros can be started in the following ways:

ul.li: Via Developer tab Macros (group Code) Select macro Run .
Using a keyboard shortcut if it is assigned to the macro.
Using a command button if such a button is created for the macro.

section.title: Deleting macros
section.p: Macros can be deleted by Developer tab Macros (group Code) Select macro Delete .
